intro: Gilia splendens subsp. grantii, commonly known as the Grant's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to violet. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Gilia splendens subsp. grantii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
